1.1	Unless otherwise referenced herein, each of the terms used herein shall have the meaning ascribed to it below: 

(i)	“Affiliate”, with respect to any Party hereto, shall mean any legal person, non-legal person economic organization, or natural person, 
which owns a controlling interest in, or which is controlling, controlled by or under common control with, such Party, directly or 
indirectly. 


As used in this Agreement, “control”	means the power of any person to direct or cause the direction of management and policies 
of another party on account of such person’s ownership of equity interest, voting right, the right to appoint directors, by contract 
or otherwise.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.1	Unless otherwise referenced herein, each of the terms used herein shall have the meaning ascribed to it below: 

(i)	“Affiliate”, with respect to any Party hereto, shall mean any entity with which a Party has a business relationship, including but not limited to subsidiaries, parent companies, sister companies, strategic partners, and joint ventures, regardless of ownership structure. 


As used in this Agreement, “control”	means the ability to influence the decisions and actions of another party, whether through equity ownership, contractual arrangements, or other means.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Affiliate' is based on direct or indirect control through ownership. The modified definition broadens it to include any entity with a business relationship, regardless of ownership, creating a contradiction. The definition of "control" is also widened, creating further ambiguity. This impacts clauses relying on a clear definition of 'Affiliate'.

4.1	The amount of the service fee and its terms of payment shall be as set forth in Attachment 1 to the “Agreement Between Phoenix Satellite TV 
and Phoenix New Media Regarding Cooperation in the Fields of Content, Branding, Promotion and Technology”	dated November 24, 
2009 between Phoenix Satellite Television Holdings Limited and Phoenix Online (Beijing) Information Technology Co., Ltd. (“Phoenix 
Online”).
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1	The amount of the service fee shall be $10,000 USD per month, payable within 30 days of invoice. The terms of payment will be negotiated separately on a quarterly basis.
perturbation.explanation: The original text refers to Attachment 1 for fee and payment terms. The modified text specifies a fixed amount and payment timeframe, contradicting the reference to a separate agreement. The addition of "negotiated separately on a quarterly basis" adds further uncertainty and contradicts the fixed price. This creates uncertainty as to which payment terms apply.

perturbation.original_text:
8.1	Both Parties agree that any breach of any of the warranties, covenants, or provisions hereof by either Party shall constitute a breach of this 
Agreement, except under circumstances described in Section 8.2 below. In the event of any breach of this Agreement by any Party 
hereto, the breaching Party shall indemnify the other Party for all of such other Parties losses arising therefrom, which losses shall 
include only direct losses, reasonable expenses and reasonable attorney fees.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.1	Both Parties agree that any material breach of any of the warranties, covenants, or provisions hereof by either Party shall constitute a breach of this Agreement, except under circumstances described in Section 8.2 below. In the event of any breach of this Agreement by any Party hereto, the breaching Party may be liable for the other Party's losses arising therefrom, at the sole discretion of a mutually agreed upon mediator, which losses shall be limited to provable direct damages.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states 'any breach' constitutes a breach, while the modification states 'any material breach'. The original text states the breaching party 'shall indemnify', while the modification states they 'may be liable at the sole discretion of a mediator'. The modified text removes attorney fees and limits it to 'provable direct damages', contradicting the original inclusion of 'reasonable expenses and reasonable attorney fees'.
